channel.title: Projext! lol ~~teleblocking and jail~~
channel.description: ok when the user is jailed ex ::jail brandon it sends them to jail. but when they relog the can telly again! lol any help projext

item.title: Projext! lol ~~teleblocking and jail~~
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

all i have in client.java are:

[code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 15000000);
addItem(392, 100000);
sendMessage(“You Have Now Started B15PKZ”);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“Sorry.”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!!");

        }
    }

[/code]

public int starter = 0; public int stealtimer; public int Reptimer = 0; public int EnemyY = 0; public int EnemyX = 0; //Start of Fire Making public int xpgained = 1;//Change this and the fire xp will be times by that, so 40 time 1 = 40, 40 times 100 = 4000.

[code] if (NPCID == 1051) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 50000000);
addItem(392, 5000);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“Why do you have to be greedy?”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " is really greedy trying to type ::starter again");

            }
        }

[/code]

playerEnergy = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-starter")) { starter = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-gametime")) { playerGameTime = Integer.parseInt(token2); 

characterfile.newLine();
            characterfile.write("character-ancients = ", 0, 21);
            characterfile.write(Integer.toString(ancients), 0,
                    Integer.toString(ancients).length());
            characterfile.newLine();
            characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);
            characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0,
                    Integer.toString(starter).length());
            characterfile.newLine();
            characterfile.write("character-hasegg = ", 0, 19);
            characterfile.write(Integer.toString(hasegg), 0,
                    Integer.toString(hasegg).length());
            characterfile.newLine();

item.title: Projext! lol ~~teleblocking and jail~~

item.description:
@Projext wrote:

character-clueid = 0 character-cluelevel = 0 character-cluestage = 0 character-lastlogin = ip character-lastlogintime = 20091019 character-reputation = 0 character-ancients = 0 character-starter = 1 character-hasegg = 0 character-hasset = 0 character-pkpoints = 35 character-killcount = 13 character-deathcount = 1 character-mutedate = 0 character-height = 0
Find thast in your main class file, I think 317 is client.java or something, look for the ::starter command, in there it will have blahblah starter +1 or something, post it here, or anything else there like ancients or hasegg…

item.description:

You know when you open up your players account’s, I don’t know if they have it in 317, but there are variables that stay on the account even if they log out, try adding it to that instead of wherever it is now?
